thread.title: New Denver sheriff Patrick Firman takes oath, gets to work
thread.title_full: New Denver sheriff Patrick Firman takes oath, gets to work - The Denver Post

author: Noelle Phillips
title: New Denver sheriff Patrick Firman takes oath, gets to work
text:
Denver's new sheriff began his tenure Friday with his family on his right and the department's top brass on his left as he took his oath of office.
Sheriff Patrick Firman told a crowd of city officials that he was excited to be Denver's next sheriff and that he was well aware of the work he faces.
He also got a few laughs when he said, "I've grown up in jails. I've spent most of my career in jails ... working in jails."
Firman was given the oath of office by Denver County Court Judge John Marcucci during a quick ceremony in the Wellington Webb Municipal Office Building.
Firman's wife and daughter drove in from Illinois for the ceremony. His son could not travel because of schoolwork.
Firman has 24 years of experience working in jails in two suburban Chicago counties. For the past year, he has worked as a law enforcement consultant.
The jails where Firman has worked are smaller and less diverse than what he will oversee in Denver. But Firman has said his foundation is solid and that he is prepared to take the reigns of a troubled department that is undergoing a massive reform .
Advertisement Firman, who spent Friday meeting with the department's senior leaders, said he is ready to get to work.
"Like most people who work in jails, we don't put a lot of stock in what people say," he said. "We put stock in what people do."
Mayor Michael Hancock announced his intention to find a new sheriff in July 2014 . After a national search conducted by Chicago-based Hillard Heintze, Firman was selected from 25 applicants.
His hiring was announced abruptly Thursday morning, much to the surprise of many community members who had been heavily involved in the sheriff's department reform.
Chief Elias Diggins had been serving as interim sheriff but has run into trouble in the past month. An internal affairs investigation is on- going after he was accused in September of releasing a suspect in custody, and he was embarrassed by a secretly recorded phone call that surfaced during a disciplinary hearing for a former chief who had been fired.

Hancock said Thursday those recent events were not connected to the sudden announcement that Firman would be sheriff.
Hancock said again Friday that Firman was the sheriff he had been searching for. Firman's references were impeccable, the mayor said.
"He will do the right thing while also leading a dynamic department," Hancock said.
